1.title: Counter Terrorism with John Nagl

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

1.plot: Jon Du Pre discusses the war on terror with John Nagl, an architect of US counterinsurgency strategy.

2.title: Children Choosing Careers

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

2.plot: Jon Du Pre questions how children in high school and even junior high can figure out what they want to be when they grow up. He talks to educators and kids about getting a head start on the future.

3.title: Politics & Religion

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

3.plot: Jon examines religious bigotry and religion & politics with professor, philosopher, and Washington Post contributor, John Mark Reynolds.

4.title: Divorce Workshop for Kids

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

4.plot: Jon Du Pre discusses how kids have friends in the Utah Court system - counselors who help them understand that divorce is not their fault, that they are not alone and teaches them how and where to draw lines. Jon and Guests discuss surveys that show how both kids and parents say the workshops are well worth the time and effort.

5.title: A Life of Photography

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

5.plot: David Burnett looks back on 40 years photojournalist, capturing and freezing a moments all around the world. Jon Du Pre gets the back story, the words behind pictures on exhibit at the UMFA at the University of Utah.

6.title: Gregg Easterbrook

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

6.plot: Jon Du Pre sits down with author Gregg Easterbrook and discusses some of the "hot" topics in Easterbrook's latest book, "Sonic Book," including globalization and the economy.

7.title: Remembering Steve Jobs

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

7.plot: Jon Du Pre and guest David Bradford reflect on the life of Steve Jobs and how Jobs has forever changed the technology industry.

8.title: Nobel Women

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

8.plot: Susan Merrill and Peter von Sivers discuss the two Liberian and one Yemeni women who won the Nobel Peace Prize.

9.title: Jobs, Jobs, Jobs

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

9.plot: Jon Du Pre sits down with Chief Economist, Mark Knold, to discuss unemployment in America and how it is effecting college graduates. Later, Bill Brady and Leslie Kawai share information on where the jobs are and how to get them.

10.title: Playing by the Rules

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

10.plot: Jon discusses how college football and basketball players make millions for their schools but how a scholarship doesn't always cover their cost of living. We hear a lot about those who break the NCAA rules, but what about the players and coaches who play by the rules?

11.title: Farmers' Markets

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

11.plot: If you eat food grown within 250 miles of your front steps, you are a "locavore." Jon talks with several guests about how buying and eating local foods can help your economy and your health.

12.title: Self Reliant Living

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

12.plot: Jon Du Pre travels to Denver, Colorado, to the National Self Reliance Expo, to look into the lifestyles of people preparing for a day when Americans will have to provide their own food, fuel, and energy.

13.title: Amazing Birds

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

13.plot: Dr. Brian Watts, a researcher, from the College of William and Mary, shares his amazing new discoveries into the lives of Whimbrels, a species of shorebird that migrate between Alaska and Latin America.

14.title: Drug Rationing

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

14.plot: Jon Du Pre discusses with his guests how supplies of critical pharmaceutical drugs are becoming more scarce. They also look at a new website, an "Angie's List" for health care consumers, that allows families to compare and contrast doctors and hospitals to find the best care.

15.title: Chemistry Week

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

15.plot: Jon Du Pre talks to scientists and professionals who are making strides in chemistry that bring new products into your every-day life.

16.title: Philosophy with Rémi Brague

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

16.plot: An internationally renowned philosopher defends the family against modern-day skepticism and society's prevailing objections to "giving life" by bringing children into the world.

17.title: Innovations in Medical Care

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

17.plot: Jon Du Pre talks about a "bloodless" scalpel invented by Phoenix neurosurgeon Dr. Kim Manwaring will revolutionize how surgeons do their job. Jon also talks with Bradley Bertoch about the big picture in the "life sciences" sector in the West; how these innovators are creating jobs and wealth.

1.title: Aggression

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

1.plot: Host Jon Du Pre and guest Robert Ridge, a social psychologist, explore motivations and triggers for aggressive behavior in humans.

2.title: Fantasy Literature with Brandon Mull

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

2.plot: New York Times bestselling author of the "Fablehaven" series, Brandon Mull, opened up to Insight's host, Jon Du Pre, about writing fantasy literature and about his new series "Beyonders."

3.title: Mothers of the Year

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

3.plot: Insight goes on location to the 2011 American Mothers National Convention. Jon Du Pre interviews the Mother of the Year, Ernestine Allen, and the Young Mother of the Year, Shawni Pothier. In the last fifty years the mother's role has shifted in our society. Du Pre discusses with Allen and Pothier what some of those changes are and how to embrace being a mother in the 21st Century. Being a mom today is tough, and Allen and Pothier tell Du Pre how they enjoy the job while still dealing with the challenges that face them daily. In this episode they share their wisdom and...

4.title: John Gray on Relationships

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

4.plot: Jon Du Pre interviews John Gray, author of "Men Are from Mars, Women Are from Venus." They discuss relationships and how couples often blame their partners for their high amounts of stress.

5.title: The Science of Wildfire

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

5.plot: Forest fire expert and BYU professor Tom Fletcher discusses his in-lab wildfire research with Jon Du Pre. Through simulating wildfires on a small laboratory scale, Fletcher and his team can get insight into how forest fires burn and spread, providing the U.S. Forest Service with information on how to better fight the flames.

6.title: Religious Bigotry with John Mark Reynolds

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

6.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

7.title: Whole Foods, the Whole Truth

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

7.plot: Jon gets the whole truth on whole foods with nutritional scientist Tory Parker. He learns the benefits of eating whole foods, compares the value of organic foods to that of processed food, and reviews ways to fit whole foods into your diet.

8.title: Congressional Reform Challenges

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

8.plot: Jon Du Pre discusses the changing dynamic of Congress over the last century with BYU political science professors Quin Monson and Chris Karpowitz.

9.title: Parenting in Cyberspace

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

9.plot: Jon Du Pre discusses the risks of technology with BYU computer science professor Charles Knutson and learn how to protect your children from the dangers of cyberspace.

10.title: Green Building

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

10.plot: Jon Du Pre explores the latest advances in energy efficiency and environmental conservation. He finds that these developments allow homes and offices to heat and cool themselves at a fraction of the traditional cost and save valuable natural resources as well.

11.title: Autism: Where Are We Today?

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

11.plot: Jon talks with experts from the Southwest Autism Research and Resource Center and discuss the effects of autism and how to treat the disorder.

12.title: Autism: Autistic Children Becoming Adults

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

12.plot: Jon talks with experts from the Southwest Autism Research and Resource Center (SARRC) to discuss the effects of Asperger's Syndrome and how to help children with autism transition to adulthood.

13.title: Shakespeare in Today's Age

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

13.plot: Jon discusses Shakespeare's modern-age appeal with Utah Shakespeare Festival founder Fred C. Adams and education director Michael Bahr.

14.title: Brain Injuries & Healing

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

14.plot: Du Pre and Dr. Erin Bigler discuss the difficulties in diagnosing and treating traumatic brain injury and the lack of adequate treatment and long-term rehabilitation.

15.title: Immigrant Worker Rights

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

15.plot: Du Pre and Carolina Núñez discuss the legal rights of immigrant workers, including legislation, reform, and the economic ramifications of undocumented immigration.

16.title: Tragedy's Legacy: Life After 9/11 Special

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

16.plot: In honor of the 10th anniversary of 9/11, Jon examines the impact this tragedy had on America and the world.

17.title: A New Way to Fight Malaria

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

17.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

18.title: Football Independence

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

18.plot: Notre Dame's and BYU's athletic directors discuss with Jon the advantages and disadvantages of their football teams playing as independents.

19.title: Human Trafficking

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

19.plot: Du Pre discusses the nature of human trafficking in the 21st century with FBI agents Matt Miller and Nancy Person and discovers what you can do to protect your families and neighborhoods.

20.title: Interview with the Moroccan Ambassador Aziz Mekouar

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

20.plot: Insight's Jon Du Pre and the Ambassador of Morocco to the United States discuss what the Arab Spring movement means to a centuries old kingdom in the Arab world.

21.title: The Middle East

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

21.plot: Jon Du Pre reviews the recent "Arab Spring" movement in the Middle East and discuss the possibility of democracy in that region.

22.title: U.S. Government Debt Crisis

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

22.plot: Host Jon Du Pre and guests David Magleby and Michael Hendron look at the power plays on Capitol Hill and the capital markets evident during the negotiations to escape default on US government obligations.

23.title: Medicating Our Children

episode of.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre (TV Series 2011– )

23.plot: Jon Du Pre talks with a neuropsychologist and a neuropsychiatrist about the diagnosis and treatment of children with anxiety and mood and behavioral disorders.

imdb.title: Insight with Jon Du Pre
akas: Insight with Jon Du Pre (United States)
plot: Insight is an issues-driven interview show focusing on topics that are timely, sometimes provocative if not controversial.::Anonymous
